results.title: Puppetry: string marionettes
results.creator_credit: Frank Haines and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes the making of a puppet in detail from the carving of the head to the fitting of the strings. Close-ups show how the movements of the various limbs are achieved and finally the film portrays a brief episode in the story of Hansel and Gretel.

results.title: Puppeteer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
Depicts the modified way of life of a traditional Rajasthan puppeteer in Vdaipur today. Living in a tent on a street corner, Bansilal works in a superb Maharajah’s Palace, now converted to a five star hotel.

results.title: Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!
results.brief_description: In 2012, Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of a Moscow cathedral to protest the Orthodox Church’s support of Putin’s election campaign. Though two members were arrested and jailed, the other members of the group made the performance into a music video.

constellations_other.name: Access to resistance
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how access to new recording devices has inspired guerilla filmmaking and protest, helping challenge cultural, societal and political norms.

results.title_for_label: Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!
results.description: On 21 February 2012, five members of Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of Moscow’s Cathedral of Christ the Savior. Their actions were stopped by church security officials. By evening, they had turned it into a music video entitled “Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!”. The women said their protest was directed at the Orthodox Church leader’s support for Putin during his election campaign.
description_for_label: On 21 February 2012, five members of Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of Moscow’s Cathedral of Christ the Savior. Their actions were stopped by church security officials. By evening, they had turned it into a music video entitled “Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!”. The women said their protest was directed at the Orthodox Church leader’s support for Putin during his election campaign.

results.title: Punitive damage
results.creator_credit: Annie Goldson, Gaylene Preston and Occasional Productions
results.brief_description: Australian Kamal Bamadhaj was shot dead by the Indonesian military during the massacre at Santa Cruz cemetery in Dili in November 1991. A student of History and Indonesian Politics at the University of New South Wales, Bamadhaj was also one of the first foreigners to visit East Timor since the invasion of 1975. He had travelled there to assist in a human rights investigation. In her grief, his mother Helen Todd became determined to avenge her son’s death. She eventually found a way to fight the Indonesian government and those responsible for her son’s killing, in a landmark international court case. As the story unfolds, it becomes not only the tale of a mother’s sorrow, but also testimony to the brutal reality of Indonesia’s military occupation of East Timor.

results.title: Pumiceland
results.brief_description: The Central Plateau of the North Island of New Zealand was laid waste by a volcanic upheaval 2000 years ago and since then has remained a wasteland. This film tells the story of the attempts and final success of farmers and scientists to make it a productive area.
results.description: The Central Plateau of the North Island of New Zealand was laid waste by a volcanic upheaval 2000 years ago and since then has remained a wasteland. This film tells the story of the attempts and final success of farmers and scientists to make it a productive area.

results.title: Pulse of life
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardonyi, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: The story of artificial respiration and artificial circulation from the earliest times, also detailed illustrations of modern methods of mouth to mouth resuscitation and heart massage. Emphasis is placed on diagnosis and treatment; distinguishing between unconsciousness and cardiac arrest; what happens when breathing and circulation stop; how to detect conditions which cause death. Presents procedures for treating a resuscitation emergency until the victim recovers or medical help is available.

results.title: Pulpy kidney, enterotoxaemia in sheep
results.brief_description: Details of the ravages caused to Australian sheep by the disease enterotoxaemia are graphically shown in this film. Methods of treatment and control are shown in detail and the need for prevention of this disease by vaccination is stressed.
results.description: Details of the ravages caused to Australian sheep by the disease enterotoxaemia are graphically shown in this film. Methods of treatment and control are shown in detail and the need for prevention of this disease by vaccination is stressed.

results.title: Pulleys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Illustrates a simple machine and, by explaining the principle of its operation, shows how pulleys make possible the lifting of heavy loads with a minimum of effort. Both the fixed pulleys , which changes the direction of force and the moveable pulleys which multiply force are examined in detail along with the block and tackle system. Shows the functions of different kinds if pulleys as they are seen in everyday use.

results.title: Puffins, predators and pirates
results.creator_credit: Nancy Archibald and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The picturesque biological study gives striking evidence of how as order can be a threat to an entire different species: in this case the relatively rare North Atlantic Penguin. High multiplication rate of herring gulls forces them to attack penguins homeward-bound from fishing trips to rob them of their catch.
